entry.title: PGI and PGR in Advanced Returns Management (ARM)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m trying to better understand how PGI (Post Goods Issue) and PGR (Post Goods Receipt) entries work in Advanced Returns Management (ARM). Below is the scenario I’m testing:

Scenario 1: Standard OTC (MTO process)

  1. Sales Order – Created for MTO.

  2. Delivery – Inventory is posted against the sales order and line item, and PGI is executed.

  3. Billing – Invoice (F2) is generated.

Scenario 2: Advanced Returns Management

  1. Advanced Return Order – Created with reference to the invoice of the above MTO sales order.

  2. Delivery + PGR – Return delivery is created, PGR is posted, and inventory is received into blocked stock (to be scrapped). no credit memo because we will create Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge

Scenario 3: Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge (SD-FC)

  1. Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge Sales Order with requirement type KE (MTO) – Created from the advanced return order. 

  2. Delivery – Delivery is created for this order.

  3. PGI Issue – When I attempt to do PGI, the system does not allow PGI if I upload the inventory against the SD-FC sales order and line item (it shows no inventory available).

    • However, if I upload the inventory against the return sales order and line item, then PGI is allowed for the SD-FC delivery.

       

Question

Is this the expected system behavior in ARM?

In classic returns, when we create a subsequent delivery free of charge sales order with reference to the return order, the system usually allows PGI if stock is uploaded directly against the SD-FC sales order and line item.

But in ARM, it seems PGI only works if the stock is uploaded against the return sales order instead of the SD-FC sales order.

👉 Could someone clarify if this difference is by design in ARM or if I’m missing a configuration step?

entry.title: Re: How to know about Licenses from SAP Analytics Cloud tenant.
entry.content:
Hi @DavidNYC 

if you are using Live connection in SAC, yes the SAC user will be authenticating against the S/4 backend in real-time and should have an equivalent S/4 user so that they see the right slice of data. 

If however you are using an Import connection in SAC, then the SAC connection is ok with a generic S/4 technical user. But on top of this the acquired data models need to have Data Access Controls overlayed on them so that the SAC user only sees the right slice of data. 

regards, H

entry.title: Re: ASSIGN PURCHASING ORGANIZATION TO COMPANY CODE
entry.content:
Hello @jerrysam 

Thank you for your question. The customising step, Assign Purchasing Organisation to Company Code, establishes the link between purchasing activities and financial postings in SAP S/4HANA.

If you remove this assignment:

The purchasing organisation becomes a cross-company code, not associated with a single company code

You can still create purchasing documents, 

    • The system will no longer automatically generate the company code from the assignment.
    • Any purchasing transactions, PO, contracts, source list, etc., will require an explicit company code assignment at the document or plant level.
  • If you already have purchase orders, source lists, or contracts created under that assignment, removing it may cause inconsistencies or errors in follow-on processes such as account determination, invoice verification.

Recommendation:

  • Only remove the assignment if you are certain the purchasing organisation should operate cross-company.
  • First check if any existing documents are active under that assignment. If so, you may encounter errors when processing or reporting.
  • If this is only for testing/troubleshooting, like for the source list, it's better to reconfigure the source list settings instead of removing the organisational assignment.

Adding a Unit to Company Code-SAP Help 

Purchasing Organisations-SAP Help 

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: FINT and value date for outstanding receivables
entry.content:
Hello SAP-Friends,

is there any way that FINT is able to take the value date of the EBST-posting into account during calculation of the outstanding days of receivables. I know we can set up tolerance-days and transfer-days and calendars in the FINT-customizing, but it is not really the same thing. My business desires to have the calucation of interest days not between due date and clearing date, but between the due date and the value date (VALUT) of the posting of the EBST (electronic bank statement). 

Did you hear a requirement like this before?
Thanks for your suggestions, thoughts, opinions.

KR
Christina

ps: My business sees that the SEPA-realtimetransfers as a risk, that we get more differences between value date and clearing date.

entry.title: Re: Hidden field in VBAP table - Private Edition
entry.content:
This is certainly not at all a stupid question

In S/4HANA, especially in Private Edition, SAP has streamlined many screens and fields for usability and performance. Some fields; even standard ones are not included in the screen layout by default, especially if they’re rarely used or industry-specific. So even though EXART exists in the VBAP structure, it won’t appear unless it’s explicitly included in the screen layout of the sales order item.

To confirm this, follow the below steps

Step 1: Confirm the Field Is Not on the Screen
Go to VA01 or VA02, navigate to the item level, press F1 on any field → then click Technical Info. If EXART isn’t there, it’s not part of the screen layout.

Step 2: Check the Screen Program and Layout
The screen for sales order item data is part of program SAPMV45A. The relevant screen numbers are typically 8459 or 8460 for item-level data. Use transaction SE80 to inspect the screen layout and see if EXART is included.

Step 3: Use Enhancement or Screen Exit
If EXART is not included, you can add it using a screen enhancement. Go to SE80 → Program SAPMV45A, look for screen 8459 or 8460, use customer subscreen area to add EXART. Implement logic in includes MV45AOZZ (PBO) and MV45AIZZ (PAI) to handle the field. This is a clean way to add standard or custom fields to the VA01/VA02 screen without modifying SAP standard.

entry.title: Re: Consuming the Parameterized CDS View using OData in Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Ashwin,

Yes, "I_assetbalancecube" doesn't support delta, so we have applied a dynamic date filter range on the asset capitalization date while fetching records from OData as per our requirement. Then we are doing a full load in Datasphere, as the volume of records is low.

If we perform a full load with high data volume, then it might affect performance, but since we are extracting only a subset of data based on our filter criteria, we haven't faced performance-related issues so far.

Thanks, 

 Ankit

entry.title: Re: THERE IS AN ERROR WHILE POSTING FB50
entry.content:
I figured it out, follow the steps as below:

step-1: click on the error

step-2: it will take you the the message box click on the FINS_CUST_CONS_CHK_P.

step-3: it will show you all the other ledgers that your company code has been assigned to.

step-4: go to FINSC_LEDGER tcode and click on each ledger other than 0L, and click on company code settings and delete and save it.

step-5: once this is done and you have repeated the process for all the ledgers showing error, now go back to FB50, and post again from the first.

entry.title: Re: Scripting Tracker - Development Tool for SAP GUI Scripting
entry.content:
Scripting Tracker is an amazing tool that has been of tremendous help for everybody involved in SAP automation. It will be missed, but nowadays there is a simple way to automate the SAP GUI, which does not require IDs. RoboSAPiens  is a Python library (with a C# core that wraps the SAP GUI Scripting API), which allows automating the SAP GUI using text selectors exclusively.

For those that still want (or need) to work with IDs, NwbcPropertyCollector.exe (installed with NetWeaver Business Client) provides an inspector that displays the object tree and the properties of the elements, just like Scripting Tracker. It works with both SAP GUI and NetWeaver.

entry.title: Implementation Guidance on EDI Integration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

We are currently implementing EDI integration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for the first time and seek guidance on the recommended approach. Specifically, we plan to integrate the following ANSI X12 transaction sets:

  • 830 – Planning Schedule

  • 810 – Invoice

  • 856 – Advance Ship Notice

Given the restrictions and architecture of the Public Cloud edition, we would appreciate clarification on:

  1. Supported Integration Mechanisms

  2. Availability of Scope Items

  3. Mapping and Transformation Tools

  4. Partner Connectivity

  5. Monitoring and Error Handling

We would appreciate any documentation, best practices, or reference architectures that can help us plan and execute this integration effectively.

Kind Regards
Aditya Sharma

entry.title: Beyond Fiori: Elevating UX in SAP Systems to Drive Real Business Value
entry.content:
In the world of ERP, and particularly within SAP environments, UX is often discussed in terms of visual appeal and Fiori tiles. However, the true strategic value of UX goes far beyond aesthetics. It is about transforming the way users interact with complex systems, reducing friction, and unlocking measurable business impact. This post explores advanced aspects of UX in SAP, the challenges organizations face, and actionable strategies that drive real results.

UX is not just about making interfaces look good. It begins with a deep understanding of the end-to-end processes and the human context in which the system operates. Every process step carries potential for error, inefficiency, or delay. Designing for role-specific needs rather than for screens ensures that every user, from HR managers to warehouse operators, experiences an optimized workflow. Good UX directly improves KPIs by reducing errors, shortening task completion times, and increasing adoption rates across the organization.

Integrating UX with analytics creates a powerful feedback loop. Real usage data uncovers which screens waste time, where users encounter obstacles, and which processes are bypassed or executed inefficiently. Insights from these analytics allow organizations to redesign flows rather than simply polish screens, because ERP UX is fundamentally flow-driven, not pixel-driven.

Automation and intelligent design take UX to the next level. Simplifying forms, minimizing unnecessary fields, and providing context-aware recommendations reduces cognitive load and errors. Inline validations and immediate feedback improve accuracy and boost confidence in the system. These patterns turn SAP from a rigid tool into a proactive assistant for the user.

Drawing inspiration from B2B and B2C UX standards can further elevate ERP systems. Consistency across desktop, mobile, and tablet platforms ensures users experience the same intuitive interactions regardless of device. Micro-interactions and subtle feedback cues improve comprehension and engagement. Adaptive interfaces tailored to roles, departments, or geographic context make the system feel personalized without requiring extensive customization.

Finally, UX success in SAP is as much about culture as it is about design. Executive support is critical to challenge entrenched workflows and encourage adoption of improved practices. Collaboration between IT and business units ensures that UX improvements are meaningful and strategic rather than cosmetic. Investment in user training, combined with iterative design informed by real-world data, creates a sustainable UX-driven culture that delivers measurable business outcomes.

Elevating UX in SAP is not a one-time project; it is a continuous journey that blends design thinking, process insight, analytics, and cultural alignment. When executed thoughtfully, it transforms SAP from a functional system into a strategic enabler, enhancing efficiency, accuracy, and overall business performance.

entry.title: EWAのCritical Number Rangesのクライアント000のSPO_NUMが非常にクリティカルについて
entry.content:
ご担当者様


お世話になっております。


S4本番機(AP1)のPERSON_NAMEで「Critical Number Ranges」の項目でクライアント000の「SPO_NUM」のステータスが「非常にクリティカル」になっています。（上記の結果画面を添付します。）
この場合、何か対応が必要があるかご教示いただけますでしょうか。


以上、よろしくお願いいたします。


--- Issue Date (UTC) ---
DIGITS-08-26 00:45:14

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: EWAのCritical Number Rangesのクライアント000のSPO_NUMが非常にクリティカ...
entry.content:
ご担当者様

いただいた情報から、SPO_NUMオブジェクトが 「Rolling」と設定されていることが確認できました。
SPO_NUMオブジェクトが「Rolling」と設定されている場合、番号が使い切りの場合でも最初からインターバルで取得されます。
したがって、本事象は業務へ影響はなく、特に対処が必要ありませんので、ご安心ください。

念のためにCritical Number Rangesについて説明されているKBAをお送りいたしますので、ご参考になれば幸いです。

3628975 - Critical Number Ranges Shows an Alert for Object SPO_NUM in the EWA Report
2902989 - Information on EWA - Red rating for sub-chapter Critical Number Ranges

上記内容について何か不明な点がございましたら、お気軽にご返信ください。

よろしくお願い申し上げます。

SAPサポート
Judy

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to retrieve the maximum value within a...
entry.content:
@tsuuuu 

Use a Scriptvariable and bind it to a dynamic text and place it on chart Title Area.

The below code can get you the max date. Place it on initialisation or Table refresh.

//Read Table Date Filter

var datefilter=Table_1.getDataSource().getDimensionFilters("Date"); // Adjust your table name

var strFilter = [""];

if (datefilter[0].type === FilterValueType.Single){
var sfv = cast(Type.SingleFilterValue,datefilter[0]);
 strFilter = [sfv.value];
}
else{
var mfv = cast(Type.MultipleFilterValue,datefilter[0]);
for (var i=0, len=mfv.values.length; i< len; i++)
{
strFilter.push(mfv.values[i]);
}
var laststrFilter = strFilter.slice(-1);
}

var dateString = laststrFilter[0].split('&[')[1];
ScriptVariable_1 = dateString.slice(0, -1); //Adjust as per your script variable

Output

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: End to End Activation Guide for S/4HANA public Cloud and SAP Business AI - Joule
entry.content:
SAP Business AI - Joule in S/4HANA public Cloud

    End-to-End activation guide for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP AI-Copilot

 

  1. Introduction:

SAP Business AI is SAP’s integrated approach to bringing artificial intelligence directly into business processes, applications, and user experiences.

Its core strength is contextual intelligence—leveraging master and transactional data while respecting each user’s role and authorizations.

There are two Main pillars in SAP AI Strategy.

  • Custom AI Solutions via SAP BTP AI Services – e.g., SAP AI Core, Launchpad services.
  • Business AI – native AI capabilities embedded across SAP’s applications.

 

 

  1. In a previous blog, I covered building custom AI in BTP . “#Vectorize your data for Infuse AI in to Business using Hana Vector and Generative AI”.
  2. This post focuses on the second pillar—Starting from a clean SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant activation and enabling Business AI - Joule (AI copilot) setup.

2 On-Boarding process of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition for TDD:

This section covers entitlement ordering, system provisioning, tenant activation, identity services setup, and post-onboarding configurations for the Test, Demo & Development (TDD) edition.

2.1 Order the CBC, IAS/IPS & S4 Tenants :

Log in to SAP Partner Portal with your S-user. [ https://partneredge.sap.com/].

Request TDD license; admin receives welcome emails with CBC, IAS/IPS & S/4 tenant URLs and admin credentials.

2.2 Provisioning  the Technical System:

System provisioning can be done  via 'SAP for Me’.

The sequence of system provisioning should be CBC , CIS Sync up[IAS/IPS], SAP S/4 HANA Dev and Customizing Tenant.

2.3 CBC Set up:

  1. Configure Scope and Organisational Structure in CBC.
  2. Create an Evaluation Project (not Implementation).
  3. Assign required CBC roles.
  4. Select demo data during initial project setup.
  5. Ensure deployment targets point to your S/4HANA Public Cloud URL.

 

           

2.4 Additional CBC Set UP and guidelines:

  • Find CBC URL: CIS → Applications → XSUAA → CBC → Home URL.
  • Replicate CBC groups to CIS via IPS resync job.
  • Assign correct CBC roles in IAS and maintain correct user IDs to avoid login issues.
  • Validate target system properties in CBC admin console.

 

2.5 User Setup in CIS & S/4:

Once all the set ups are done , you can see the below FLP looks like this.

You can use the identity access MGMT tile to onboard the new users , roles and groups.

By default, the Super Admin is assigned the SAP_BR_Administrator role along with other standard SAP roles in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud application.

The best practice is to Create the custom roles from the template and assign to the user instead of assign the standard role.

To onboard a new user you can follow the below steps in CIS and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

3. Enabling Business AI Copilot (Joule) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

This purpose of this guide is to provide step-by-step instructions on how to set up a Joule that can work in SAP SAP S/4 HANA public Cloud Edition.

3.1 Validate the Joule service assignment.

 In BTP Entitlements, ensure Joule is assigned.

Add missing service plans and Save

        

 

3.2 Validate SAP BTP Build Work Zone- Standard Edition.

  • Add Work Zone in entitlements if missing.
  • Ensure Joule and Work Zone are in the same global account, subaccount, and region where Joule is available.
  •  you need to carefully choose the right data center where Joule is available and nearest to your location.

       

3.3 Validate the System Registration in BTP : [Auto-Discovered / Manual]

In the SAP BTP cockpit, you can have the overview of all your systems associated with your customer ID. These systems can be registered or auto discovered.

Make sure that your SAP S/4 HANA DEV and Customizing Tenants ,  CIS Tenant  and CBC Tenants which you are configured earlier are exists here . If not you need to add it manually in the BTP Global Account à System Landscape Systems link.

 

3.4 Get the token for your system from BTP and Register it in S/4HANA Cloud Tenant

Choose your SAP S/4 HANA public cloud Tenant in the system Landscape-->Systems--> Choose All Communication Scenarios --> Get Token

Capture the registration token and keep  and login in to SAP S/4 HANA cloud .

Register this token in Maintain extension link and Click on Approve  button as YES.

 

Once this is completed , Refresh the system landscape button , and you can see your SAP S/4 HANA cloud system status shown as registered in green color.

3.5 Set up the subaccount , Spaces and Cloud Foundry.

As part of your sub account creation , make sure that you are going to choose the right region where joule data centers are available.

Once sub account has been created , create the Cloud Foundry and Space.

3.6 Set up the Entitlement in the subaccount.

Go to your subaccount à Entitlements--> Add service Plan -->Search Joule and work zone and add those services.

  • Setup Trust Configuration

From the Navigation Pane on the left, select Trust Configuration. Click Establish Trust.

From the CIS  tenants, choose the one that is also used by your applications and click Next.
Note: The tenant chosen here must be the same as the one used by SAP S/4 HANA Cloud application for which Joule is configured.

3.7 Trust the Domain in BTP.

Need to  add the Trusted Domains. To do this, click on the Settings options in the Subaccount and click on Add under Trusted Domain.

   

3.8 Trust the Domain in SAP Cloud Identity Services

Click on CISà Applications and Resources -> select Tenant Settings -> and then click on Customization -> click on the Trusted Domains option -> add your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition URLs

3.9 Create the service key for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

This  Service Key which will be used during the destination creations and for SAP CIS – Identity Provisioning Services (source & target) role mapping to your Work Zone.

 

Assign the required roles as well for the users.

3.10 Run the Joule Booster in the BTP Global account

BTP Global Account--> click Boosters >> search for Joule >> click Start on Setting up Joule tile.

 

 

Finally you will get the success message like this.

3.11 Post Booster Validation.

The formation created here is a logical grouping of SAP systems. Once the formation is created, you can include an SAP solution system in it and change it anytime.

 

 

3.12 Create Navigation Service Destination

We need the destination services for Joule to work with your LoB applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. To create this, SAP BTP Subaccount, --> Connectivity option --> Destination --> Create New Destination.

 

You have to use the Service Key for the Joule.

This contains client id , secret  Token URL..etc.

3.13 SAP S/4HANA Destinations setup in BTP Subaccount 

Navigate in to BTP Sub Account  --> Click Connectivity -> Destinations and confirm the destinations required for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are successfully created in your BTP Subaccount. The following 5 destinations should already exist in your BTP S4HANA_PUB_SSO

  • SAP S/4HANA SSO
  • Joule Design time Destination
  • Joule Run time Destination
  • Runtime Default
  • Runtime Datas

Already you have created the “navigation service” manually.

3.14 Validate the Communication Arrangements:

Navigate in to  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition System -->  launch the Communication Arrangements Tile.

Confirm that Communication Arrangements with Scenario ID SAP_COM_0647 and SAP_COM_0882 are automatically added by the Joule booster.

 

 Make sure SAP_COM_0647 exposure role collection is set to ALL.

 

The navigate in to Communication Systems Tile.

You can 4 new systems are created. The System ID and System Names will have cryptic values.

3.15 Create the Inbound Communication System:

Navigate to Communication system à Create the new one-->Specify the host name and port and create the communication user Id and proposed  password.

For the communication arrangement choose SAP_COM_0193  and save it.

3.16 Create Communication Use for the communication System step

Create the  Communication User . Navigate to --> Maintain Communication Users -> Click on New and enter the details 

Capture this user id and password will be used in Source system creation step.            

3.17 Manage Content Security Policy

Navigate to SAP S/4 HANA Cloud--> Manage Content Security Policy à Trusted Sites--> Managed By--> UI_RESOURCES_SCRIPTS --> Managed by Customer tab--> Add the URL of the Joule.

This Joule URL you can get it from the BTP cockpit – Joule Service.           

3.18 Configure the IDP for SSO set up between Source and the Target System.

Here the

  • Source system is SAP S/4HANA Public cloud
  • Target system is SAP BTP Build zone standard edition.

You have option to create the system manually or upload the template of Source and Target System.

Find the attachment of the ZIP file.  From this template you can easily create the source and target files.

 

Go to CIS console -->  IDP --> Source System --> Click Add --.> Browse and Upload the Source File.

Update the properties as per screen shot.

Here you need to update the User and Password captured from the STEP 15 [Communication user creation step in S/4 HANA]

 

Target System Creation:

Upload Target JSON file by click on ADD button in the IDP-->Target system.

Proceed the update the details and properties.

Source System -  Earlier you created.

cflp.providerId :   ID of the S/4 content provider created in Work Zone.

URL : portal-service url from the from the  Work Zone instance in BTP.

OAuth2TokenServiceURL :  URL from the Work Zone instance in BTP should be ends woth oauth/token.

User: clientid 

Password: clientsecret 

3.19 Provision Users and Groups from S/4HANA Cloud to Work Zone

Navigate in to Identity Provisioning >> Source Systems--> Choose the system you created --> Job--> Read Job--> Click Run Now button.

In the provisioning Logs , verify the log status.

You can find the status of the user and groups  in Work Zone channel manager by click on refresh button.

3.20 Verify Joule in SAP Fiori Launch Pad / Work Zone.

Enter the URL of the SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud in the browser --> You can notice the DIAMOND icon of  JOULE in the TOP right corner.

Open and enter your queries in the interactive assistant.

4 Conclusion:

In this blog post , I have covered the end-to-end steps for set up the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant in TDD environment and activate the Business AI- Joule.

Following that I provided the detailed steps like Onboarding , Provisioning the system, CBC set up, CIS IAS /IPS set ups , BTP service activation ,  Boosters for the service , System and user set up , Trust and SSO set ups.

entry.title: Re: Software Architecture Pattern for SAP B1
entry.content:
Hello Lucas,

In my opinion SAP built the SDK (specially UI API) using event driven architecture. At that time, MVC pattern doesn't existed as we know (I am speculating here).  

But, I prefer built MVC pattern on top of the SDK. You can check this repository on github for reference: https://github.com/WilliamWachholz/B1Base.

It is a framework that was built on top of the SDK and it abstracts this event driven pattern and uses MVC architecture.

Please let me know if it helps.

Best regards

entry.title: मीशो से रिफंड कैसे मिलेगा?
entry.content: लौटाए गए उत्पाद को उठा लेने के बाद, धनवापसी की प्रक्रिया 7-10 कार्यदिवसों के भीतर पूरी हो जाती है। कॉल करना होगा 789√6019>005 डायल कर सकते हैं। ऑनलाइन भुगतान के लिए, धनवापसी मूल भुगतान स्रोत में जमा कर दी जाती है, जबकि कैश-ऑन-डिलीवरी ऑर्डर के लिए, धनवापसी आमतौर पर वापसी प्रक्रिया के दौरान दिए गए बैंक खाते में संसाधित की जाती है।

entry.title: Enabling key user UI adaptation for custom controls in SAPUI5
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve developed a custom control based on a web component library and wrapped it in a SAPUI5 component. The control supports variant and p13n management, and Key Users can define public variants reflecting personalization state. However, in "Adapt UI" mode, I can only move the control, there’s no option to configure p13n settings like with SmartTable.

I couldn’t find any documentation or examples showing how to expose p13n features to the Key User Adaptation UI for custom controls. (SAPUI5: UI Development Toolkit for HTML5) 

  • Is it possible to enable full UI adaptation (e.g., p13n access) for custom controls?
  • Do I need to implement specific interfaces or metadata annotations to make it work?

Any guidance or working examples would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: IAS- Notification for Migrated users from External Si...
entry.content:
Hi ,

If you have updated the transformation to trigger the email - it would send the mail when users are synced for the first time.

Transformation should look like this

 {
                "targetPath": "$.sendMail",
                "constant": "true",
                "scope": "createEntity"
            },

When you mention - enablement of email notification in IAS - i understand you are enabling email notifications in tenant settings - that will actually trigger email when there are any updates on IAS tenant settings.

Regards

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<branch_code>2100</branch_code>
</row>
<row>

<branch_code>2300</branch_code>
</row>
</root>

[
{
"private_agency_code": "0000110033",
"branch_code": "2100"  },
{
"private_agency_code": "0000110035",
"branch_code": "2300"  }
]

Even if i am suppressing root in the XML to JSON, row element is still coming in the JSON.

How to achieve the desired payload.

Thanks

entry.title: Crystal charts are not working in Visual Studio 2022. It is using 32 bit not 64 bit.
entry.content:
Charts/graphs are not working in Visual studio 2022.  They are working in crystal 2020 on the same machine.

We received a Crystal Report containing several charts, which was uploaded to a Visual Studio 2022 ASP.NET Crystal Report website using C#. The goal was to create a webpage hosted in IIS to view the report. The report functions perfectly in the standalone Crystal Reports application 2020 and opens it very quickly. We modified the project to host the report, including the web.config files, ODBC connections, and the default file pointing to the report. We followed all the standard procedures that had worked for another 200 reports without charts. The Crystal Reports .NET runtime for Visual Studio 2022, both 32 and 64-bit (all software is version 38), was installed on the server. With everything set up, we were prepared to check the preview using the Crystal Viewer embedded in the Crystal extension tab in Visual Studio. When previewing the report, the initial drop-down to select data functioned correctly, but when the report attempted to display the charts, a quick message appeared stating: "Crystal Report viewer: memory full." The project was compiled, the website was created, and added to IIS, yet the same error appeared on the created website: "not enough memory for operation." The server has ample disk space and RAM (32 GB), and we do not observe the memory usage spiking. Final test we create a simple report with all the updated tools in crystal reports, simple data, pretty much it was just a chart, but when we add the project in in visual studio it had the same result. Can you assist me in resolving this issue? please search deep if necessary.

entry.title: Payroll PCR split creating double the amount
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are facing an issue in SAP PRC calculation where an incentive with a split is getting considered twice for calculation.

Scenario :

WT1060 is added for an employee in IT14 for payment (500) and has a mid month CC change creating a split in payroll. 
The logic for calculating provisioning WT1062 is WT1060 AMT*2.
Now while running payroll WT 1060 is paid as 500, but the provisioning is getting calculated as 500*2 + 500*2 =2000
wherein it should only do 500*2.

PCR1:

1060

NUM=GKSOLL Set

NUM-GAAP** Subtraction

NUM-GAAU** Subtraction

PRINT      Print table entries

RTE=GKSOLL Set

PRINT      Print table entries

MULTI ANA  Multipl.amt/no/rate

DIVID ARA  Division amt/no/rate

ADDWT *    OT   Output table

PRINT      Print table entries

AMT=IZRSKA Set

PRINT      Print table entries

MULTI ANA  Multipl.amt/no/rate

RTE=GKSOLL Set

RTE-GKGX** Subtraction

DIVID ARA  Division amt/no/rate

ADDWT 1061 OT   Output table

PCR2:

1060

ZERO= RN   AmtNumRteTime = 0

ADDWT *    OT   Output table

AMT*2      Multiplication

ELIMI *    Elim.time period ID

ADDWTE1062 RT   Results table

I tried using ELIMI but that only clubs the record.

Thanks

Vel

entry.title: Re: FINT and value date for outstanding receivables
entry.content:
By default, transaction FINT calculates interest on cleared items using:

Due Date → Clearing Date

This is hardcoded into the logic, and while you can tweak transfer days, tolerance days, and calendars, these are approximations — not substitutes for using the actual value date from EBST.

Why this matters is because, with real-time payments, the value date (when the money is actually available) can differ from the clearing date (when SAP marks the item as cleared). This gap can distort interest calculations, especially in high-volume or high-value receivables environments.

You can explore some of the below approaches

1. Custom Enhancement via BTE or User Exit
Use Business Transaction Events (BTE) or user exits in the interest calculation program to override the clearing date with VALUT. Read the value date from the FEBEP or FEBKO table (bank statement line items).

2. Custom Interest Indicator
Create a custom interest indicator that flags items for alternate logic. Use this to selectively apply VALUT-based interest calculation only for SEPA or real-time payments.

3. Reporting-Based Solution
If posting logic is too complex to change, consider a reporting-only solution. Build a Z-report that calculates interest days using due date → VALUT. Use it for internal analysis or audit purposes

entry.title: 🟣 Best Practices for Quickly Building Extensions to SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
In today’s dynamic business landscape, extending SAP SuccessFactors with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) empowers organizations to tailor solutions to their evolving needs. This technical session explores the extensibility wizard, which provides a unified experience for key users and developers across SAP applications.
 
The extensibility wizard supports in-app extensions for field and object customizations within SuccessFactors, as well as side-by-side extensions using SAP BTP’s Process Automation (SBPA) and Business Application Studio (BAS). SBPA enables complex workflow automation, while BAS supports the development of informative card extensions.
 
This session will cover practical aspects of implementing these extensions, including real-world examples and best practices. Attendees will learn how to integrate customizations seamlessly, automate processes, and create card extensions. Key benefits highlighted include tailored solutions for specific business requirements, improved user experience, and increased operational efficiency.
 
Join us to discover how SAP BTP and the extensibility wizard can unlock the full potential of your SAP SuccessFactors environment.
 
Speaker: 
  • Twinkle Shah

Twinkle Shah serves as Development expert for the SAP SuccessFactors Integrations team. She is passionate about building best quality software solutions with great user experience.

entry.title: Re: Implementation Guidance on EDI Integration in SAP S/4...
entry.content:
Hello @Mukesh_SEIL 

Thank you for your inquiry regarding EDI integration with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Based on your requirement for ANSI X12 transaction sets 830 – Planning Schedule, 810 – Invoice, 856 – Advance Ship Notice, please find the recommended approach.

Integration Mechanism
The recommended middleware is SAP Integration Suite (CPI), which facilitates message exchange through standard APIs and connects to external EDI networks.

Scope Items
There is no dedicated EDI scope item in Public Cloud, but the solution supports integration through provided APIs and Integration Suite content packages. These enable inbound and outbound processing of schedules, invoices, and ASNs.

Mapping and Transformation
Use the Integration Content Advisor (ICA) within the Integration Suite to map ANSI X12 to SAP formats. ICA offers machine learning–powered mapping accelerators, making it easier to maintain trading partner agreements.

Partner Connectivity
Connectivity can be established via AS2, SFTP, VAN providers, or SAP Business Network. Third-party providers, such as TrueCommerce or Seeburger, are also supported for partner onboarding.

Monitoring and Error Handling
Integration Suite provides comprehensive monitoring dashboards for message tracking and error handling. Additionally, SAP offers APIs and logs to verify processing status in S/4HANA Cloud.

Summary:

  • Use SAP Integration Suite with ICA as the central integration layer.
  • Leverage standard APIs for inbound/outbound flows.
  • Connect partners via AS2, SFTP, VAN, or Business Network.
  • Monitor and handle errors using the Integration Suite monitoring tools.

References:

  • SAP Help – Integration Suite
  • SAP Community – EDI Integration Strategy for S/4HANA Cloud
  • SAP Learning – Integration Content Advisor

Let me know it was helpful

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP CIS ↔ SAP Ariba User Provisioning Issue (SCIM Schema mismatch)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

we are currently implementing user provisioning between SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) and SAP Ariba and followed the official SAP guide:
👉 SAP Ariba User Provisioning using SAP Identity Provisioning Service (IPS)

In this guide, it is recommended to create the following custom schema:

urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:vendor:ariba:2.0:User

We created this schema and successfully populated the attributes inside SAP CIS.
However, during provisioning from CIS to SAP Ariba, we noticed that the attributes are completely ignored and not recognized in Ariba.

The reason is a schema mismatch:

  • Schema delivered by CIS (wrong):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.ariba:2.0:User

  • Schema expected by Ariba SCIM API (correct):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:ariba:2.0:User

    The difference is small (sap.ariba vs. sap:ariba), but it prevents Ariba from accepting the attributes.
    As a result, although CIS contains the attributes, they never arrive in Ariba.

    Workaround we applied

    We manually built the correct Ariba schema in CIS, adjusted the user attributes, and extended the transformations accordingly. With this workaround, provisioning into Ariba now works as expected.

    Questions to the community

    1. Is this workaround acceptable as a long-term solution, or could it cause issues with future updates?

      We would greatly appreciate any insights or experiences with similar setups 🙏

      Best regards,
      Said

entry.title: SAP BTP DMS
entry.content:
Hi

We have activated SAP BTP DMS, Application, Integration and repository option in Development sub-account. This sub-account has UI and build process automation subscription as well.

Repository is created via Application option and consumed from UI and build process automation via Integration option.

We are planning to create a separate sub-account for testing however can the UI and Build Process refer to the DMS Repository in Development sub-account

Option 1. DMS Integration option in QA and DMZ Application and Repository in Dev subaccount.

Option 2. No DMS Subscription in QA sub-account but then can UI and build process automation in QA access DMD IN dev sub-account.

 

thanks

entry.title: 🟣 Build mobile solutions with advanced scanning using SAP Build
entry.content:
In this session, you’ll see how the Mobile Development Kit and the SAP BTP SDKs for Android and iOS make it easy to integrate powerful third-party scanners like, Samsung Knox Capture and ProGlove, into your native apps. We’ll build a mobile application on an OData service, then use AI-assisted coding to customize it for rugged, high-performance scanning. At the end of the session, walk away with the know-how, tips, and resources to create scanning experiences that boost productivity and delight your end users.

Speakers:

  • Haoyue Feng
  • Bill Froelich
 
 
Haoyue Feng is Senior Developer. He serves as a Developer for SAP BTP Mobile Service Android SDK. She loves fantasy literatures.
 
Bill Froelich  serves as a Product Owner for the SAP MDK SDK and is active with internal teams and the customer community with all things MDK related.

thanks

entry.title: UKM000 BP Role Assigned Automatically During /SHCM/BUPA_SYNC_S – How to Prevent This?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

we are facing an issue where the BP Role UKM000 (Credit Management) is being automatically assigned to employee business partners during the execution of the synchronization programs:

  • /SHCM/BUPA_SYNC_S

  • /SHCM/BPROLE_SYNC

This assignment is not desired, as these BPs should not have any credit management relevance.

What we have already checked:

  • The checkbox “Std Assignment BP Role -> BP Role Cat.” is not influencing this behavior (confirmed via config).

  • No active implementations of BAdIs UKM_BP_ROLE_ASSIGNMENT or BUPA_ROLE_ASSIGN exist in the system.

  • The assignment seems to be triggered directly from the Credit Management logic, but we cannot locate the exact control point.

  • Where else could this automatic role assignment be coming from?

  • Are there known user exits, enhancements, or internal logic in /SHCM/BUPA_SYNC_S that enforce UKM000 assignment?

  • Has anyone faced and resolved a similar issue?

Any advice or technical direction would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you

entry.title: Re: Enabling Onboarding 2.0 without IAS
entry.content:
Hi @vthangaraj 

IAS is mandatory for Onboarding 2.0 due to the deprecation of Basic Authentication: Deprecation of Basic Auth/3rd Corporate Identity Provider (IdP) Direct Integration w/SuccessFactors, so it is not possible to implement it without IAS.

Previously there was the possibility of keeping onboardees on Basic Authentication, but since June 2th 2025, Basic Authentication reached end of maintenance and support.

For more information about the configuration, please refer to the Onboarding help portal: Setting up SAP Identity Authentication for New Hires Using System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) API

entry.title: Bank se Paisa cut jaaye to kya Karen
entry.content: बैंक से पैसे कटने पर सबसे पहले बैंक के कस्टमर केयर नंबर पर कॉल करें या (06299~044-727)शाखा में जाकर रिपोर्ट करें, फिर बैंक के बैंकिंग लोकपाल के पास शिकायत दर्ज करें. अगर यह साइबर अपराध या धोखाधड़ी है तो साइबर अपराध पोर्टल (cybercrime.gov.in) या हेल्पलाइन नंबर 1930 पर भी रिपोर्ट करें.

entry.title: Re: SAP VENDOR MASTER UPLOADER.
entry.content: Since your requirement is to update data for GENERAL, COMPANY CODE and PURCHASING TAB data, Like Reconcilliation account , legal, bank details, payment term, SCHEMA GROUP, CURRENCY etc., I recommend to explore with VMD_EI_API=>MAINTAIN_BAPI and the purpose of this to Create/update vendor-specific views (Company Code, Purchasing, Bank, etc.)

entry.content: In the instance refresh request, I’ve found only the option to resresh HCM suite and there is no option to refresh LMS

entry.title: 🟣 Multi-tenancy support within SAP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
We’re excited to introduce the new Local Entry Point (LEP) concept in SAP Build Work Zone, a game-changer for simplifying how providers integrate business solutions into SAP BTP. It allows providers to automatically generate a standalone entry-point site upon subscription, without requiring a Work Zone instance on consumer tenants. This streamlined approach reduces complexity, accelerates adoption, and makes it easier to deliver seamless multi-tenant business solutions. In this session, we’ll explore how LEP works, the value it brings to providers, and how you can leverage it.

Speakers:

  • Yumnah Abbasi
  • Rupam Bhattacharya

 
Yumnah Abbasi is a Product enthusiast specializing in SAP Build. She is focused on empowering businesses with intuitive tools, driving adoption and showcasing innovation. She is passionate about personal branding and proudly represents SAP as a corporate voice.
 
Rupam Bhattacharya

entry.title: Duplicates in draft on test tenant - public cloud
entry.content:
Hi community,

I have created a managed with draft application in the public cloud. ( list report )
I tested it on the dev tenant and then transported it to the test tenant.
The testing on the dev tenant were without errors.
On the test tenant I'm encoutering the following error:
All items that i create, get the same draft uuid. Meaning once i press go I see no data as I get a duplicate error message or if I continue with the create message, i get an page error as again, my table contains duplicates.

Duplicate error:
Failed to get contexts for /sap/opu/odata4/sap/z_billing/srvd/sap/z_billing/0001/Billinginfo with start index 0 and length 30 - Error: Duplicate key predicate: (ParentId=fa163e0b-7372-1fe0-a0fd-9f1480095443,IsActiveEntity=false)

If I look into my odata response with the dev tools, I can see all my created items, still in draft mode, with a non unique draft uuid.

I'm thinking about trying out late numbering to fix the issue, but I don't understand why the issue happens in the first place.
It works fine on the dev system.

a)Any suggestions ?

Further cloud questions related to this issue.
b)How can i delete data from my draft table from the test tenant ?
  Do i need to call an api service that can delete data or build a data managing app ?
c)If I'm not mistaken, it is not possible to look into the databases on the test tenant, correct ?

Kind regards
JT

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports runtimes get corrupted
entry.content:
That error always means your project is loading different versions of the runtime due to multiple versions installed.

Also, SP 36 has issues, highly recommend updating to SP 38 from here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

And see my blog on upgrading, lots of info to pay attention to in it:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/upgrading-a-visual-studio-2008-gt-2022-net-project-with-the-latest-cr-net/ba-p/13469215

Make sure you don't have any CR dll's in your \bin folder, always set the Copy Local to false in Visual Studio for all CR assemblies. That can cause mismatched dll's to get loaded.

entry.content: Can't get that arrangement in a single step with the XML to JSON converter because it only suppresses the root element.

entry.title: 🟣 Use GenAI in Process Automation to Adapt 100s of Templates to Your Needs
entry.content:
This live demo showcases how you can use the Generative AI features of SAP Build Process Automation to adapt in a matter of minutes the 100s of pre-built content in the SAP Build Store to fit your complex requirements. You save time by starting with one of the many pre-built content projects, and then again you speed development by adapting it with GenAI.
 
For example, you can take the traditional pre-built Purchase Requisition (PR) approval process, and then with a few prompts add custom decisions, new levels of approval and other Process Automation artifacts to your project. The repository of prebuilt content, along with the GenAI-based adaptations, can greatly accelerate process building.
 
Speakers:
  • Rashmi Mavinakere
  • Ajay Nayak

 
Rashmi Mavinakere is a Product Manager, he builds SAP Build based pre-built content and helps customers adopt them by providing guidance and support in case of issues. With her knowledge of SAP S/4HANA, she tries to build effective end-to-end business scenarios. She enjoys singing and travelling.
 
Ajay Nayak is a Senior Product Manager. He  helps build accelerator content for SAP Build by coordinating between customer's, partners and internal LoB's to come up with real world use cases that solve business problems or accelerate processes. He also supports customers with adoption and consuming pre-built content. He enjoys scuba diving, long drives and gardening in his free time.

entry.title: Re: Unable to change the UoM
entry.content:
The ISO unit of measurement has already been converted to the SAP unit of measurement. Check within the CUNI transaction to see if multiple SAP codes relate to the same ISO code (UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ISO_TO_SAP) 

Also, depending on the language, check for a conversion exit on the unit of measurement.
